description.narrative: Sentinel Project is moving to Phase 2 of the Una Hakika project, a misinformation management program being piloted in Kenya. Phase 2 is an expansion: Kenya-wide, deepening relations with local partners, becoming more sustainable, expanding from SMS to social media platforms, working to mitigate rumors surrounding the 2017 election.They have proposed that UUSC support the expansion to Lamu County -- a coastal region of eastern Kenya with a population of more than 100,000 people divided into two electoral constituencies. Insecurity caused by ethnic tensions between local groups and those perceived as unwelcome outsiders settling in the area, resource conflicts, the construction of a major port which is having disruptive environmental and economic impacts, and the county's proximity to Somalia and incursions from Al-Shabaab. This atmosphere encourages the spread of rumors throughout Lamu County and into Tana River County to the west, where the Sentinel Project's Una Hakika project currently operates.
